text.0: sing with these songs thy welcome to the mighty with adoration praise and call parjanya.
text.1: the bull loud roaring swift to send his bounty lays in the plants the seed for germination.
text.2: he smites the trees apart he slays the demons all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon.
text.3: from him exceeding strong fices een the guiltless when thundering parjanya smites the wicked.
text.4: like a cardriver whipping on his horses he makes the messengers of rain spring forward.
text.5: far off resounds the roaring of the lion what time parjanya fills the sky with raincloud.
text.6: forth burst the winds down come the lightningflashes the plants shoot up the realm of light is streaming.
text.7: food springs abundant for all living creatures what time parjanya quickens earth with moisture.
text.8: thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror.
text.9: at whose behest the plants assume all colours even thou parjanya yield us great protection.
text.10: send down for us the rain of heaven ye maruts and let the stallions flood descend in torrents.
text.11: come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down our heavenly lord and father.
text.12: thunder and roar the germ of life deposit fly round us on thy chariot waterladen.
text.13: thine opened waterskin draw with thee downward and let the hollows and the heights be level.
text.14: lift up the mighty vessel pour down water and let the liberated streams rush forward.
text.15: saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness and for the cows let there be drink abundant.
text.16: when thou with thunder and with roar parjanya smitest sinners down.
text.17: this universe exults thereat yea all that is upon the earth.
text.18: thou hast poured down the rainflood now withhold it thou hast made desert places fit for travel.
text.19: thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment yea thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.
